required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prolactin Hormone in Rheumatoid Arthritis Patients With Periodontitis
clinical_study.official_title: Synovial and Gingival Crevicular Fluid Levels of Prolactin Hormone in Rheumatoid Arthritis Patients With Periodontitis

lead_sponsor.agency: October University for Modern Sciences and Arts

clinical_study.source: October University for Modern Sciences and Arts

brief_summary.textblock: In this study we will assess the presence of prolactin hormone in the gingival crevicular fluid , and synovial fluid of patient with rheumatoid arthritis and periodontitis

primary_outcome.measure: prolactin hormone levels in the tested media
primary_outcome.description: changes in prolactin hormone expression in the tested media

arm_group.description: group 1: patiernts with periodontitis and rheumatoid arthritis. only

biospec_descr.textblock: Synovial fluid and gingival crevicular fluid

study_pop.textblock: Egyptian patients with active rheumatoid arthritis and periodontitis.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- for first group patients with active rheumatoid arthritis with periodontitis.
- second group , patients with periodontitis and otherwise systemically healthy
- third group, systemically and periodontallly healthy subjects
Exclusion Criteria:
- smokers,
- pregnant or lactating females
- patients taking medications the affects levels of prolactin hormone.
- no periodontal treatment in the past six months

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: October University for Modern Sciences and Arts
